intro: Cyathea multiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaf tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk covered in persistent, fibrous roots and a crown of large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Its fronds are typically broad and arching, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Cyathea multiflora plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various forest organisms.
